abstract: A commercial that ran only once in 1964 is still studied today in academic and political circles.
snippet: A commercial that ran only once in 1964 is still studied today in academic and political circles.
lead_paragraph: It was the most negative political ad in American history. The adorable petal-picking, tow-headed tot who now approaches middle age has few regrets about her role in a commercial that revolutionized campaign politics. "It's only been in the last few years," says Monique Luiz, that she has "realized the importance of this iconic ad."
